definition: member of the senior ministerial class (old)/scholar (old)/bachelor/honorific/soldier/noncommissioned officer/specialist worker

sentences.english: A group of elegant young gentlemen were sauntering in the park.
sentences.chinese: 一羣優雅的年輕紳士在花園裏悠閒地漫步。

sentences.english: Kenny is not good-looking, but he is very gentle.
sentences.chinese: 肯尼長得不好看，但是他很有紳士風度。

sentences.english: “We’re an upscale gentleman’s club, ” he said disdainfully.
sentences.chinese: “我們可是一家高檔紳士俱樂部，”他倨傲地宣稱。

sentences.english: "Other patriots" refers primarily to the enlightened gentry.
sentences.chinese: 所說的“其他愛國人士”，則主要地是指的開明紳士。

sentences.english: There' a bespectacled seniors gentleman sitting on the chair.
sentences.chinese: 椅子上坐着一位戴眼鏡的老紳士。

sentences.english: Roderigo defied the old gentleman and refused to stir.
sentences.chinese: 羅特克還敢公然反抗那個老紳士，拒絕從命。

sentences.english: He was respected for his learning by several churchmen and other gentlemen.
sentences.chinese: 學識博得了一些牧師和其他紳士們的尊敬。
醉酒使得這位紳士丟人現眼。

sentences.english: He's a crusty old gentleman who feeds stray dogs and cats.
sentences.chinese: 他是個令人生畏的老紳士，常餵食離羣的狗和貓。

sentences.english: A plowman on his legs is higher than a gentleman on his knees.
sentences.chinese: 站着的農民比跪着的紳士高貴。

sentences.english: Sir, I hope that Perseus should think better of it.
sentences.chinese: 但是，各位紳士，我勸這位珀爾修斯先生三思而行。

sentences.english: He is an elderly gentleman, silver-haired, with a twinkle in his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位上了年紀的紳士，滿頭銀髮，兩眼炯炯有神。

sentences.english: It is true, I was always a fine starched-up gentleman!
sentences.chinese: 我又是一個漂亮紳士，一個上了漿的人。

sentences.english: He is the bald-headed, sunburned gentleman WHO dumped the pail of garbage, without any doubt.
sentences.chinese: 毫無疑問，他就是那位倒過一桶垃圾的禿頭黑臉紳士。

sentences.english: Only a gentleman like Tom Hiddleston could be my Prince Charming.
sentences.chinese: 只有像抖森這樣的紳士才能做我的白馬王子。

sentences.english: My future employer was a gentleman called Mr Frederick Fairlie.
sentences.chinese: 我未來的僱主是一位紳士，叫菲德瑞芾利。
